text: <https://spin.d.pr/EVctJV+> Anyone know whats up with this? I went to edit a blog template and got this view source thing…?
It WAS a drag n drop template, I’m very confused

I think someone screwed up the edit blog template button on the front end in the little sprocket menu. It doesn’t go to edit the current template, it shows you the source code of the template as if you converted to a coded template. neat feature but definitely not what Is expected when you go to “Edit template” it’s not “clone as coded” or “view source of template”
I've been noticing the same thing as Jon and it's happening on the old design manager as well, where it takes you to a fully coded version of the blog rather than the drag and drop verison.
BTW for anyone experiencing this annoying issue It appears you can get to the drag n drop version by clicking the back to template button
Thanks for reporting this <@U7SL518D6>. I’ll talk to whoever owns the sprocket menu and see if we can fix this ASAP.
<@U7SL518D6> would you mind linking me to the blog where this is occurring?
<http://www.plasticcomponents.com/news>
if you were working on fixing that issue It appears to be fixed, I’m not seeing it happen when i edit template from the sprocket menu anymore
Hm interesting, I know what would have been causing that, but did not change anything. Have you updated any of your blog settings since this was occurring?
<@U6W3H6YN8> It's happening on our blog: <https://www.sparkreaction.com/blog>
I did edit the listing part of the blog content module in the template, in-case that helps
only other change I made was I changed the default file hosting domain to be the site’s real domain instead of HS
<@U26C29XPH> would you mind swapping the blog template, saving it, and then switching back (very quickly)? <https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/245209/marketing/blogs/39773794/templates>
Done
Now it loads the proper template when I use the sprocket to edit

Great, yea the FE was not sending an important field that the BE uses to render that sprocket menu link. The issue is now fixed, but we could not retroactively correct that bad data. This only affected the tools menu, rendering was all good
Jon, odd about yours, slack me if it starts happening again
Thanks!
Will do

would be great have an extra action for fields and groups: clone it in CMs.  Maybe it exist and I didn't found it, but
I am working in a CM which has some similar choice fields and I have to put all the choices over and over (because I am using some CSS classes for some simple customization so, it is taking some time :))
For now I am managing editing the selectors by FTP but it breaks the flow and would be much more faster do it directly in the IDE
